content: plastic bag yarn plarn sleeping mat i work with my church to make these mats for a charity we support this charity distributes them to the homeless in our area we get a lot of positive feedback from the recipi- ents and i m trying to make as many as i can if you have a charity near you that works with the homeless consider asking them if these would make a good donation as well as impacting someone s quality of life we are also keeping plastic out of landfills while we can t use every part of the bags we are still recycling a lot of plastic materials to make the plarn plastic grocery bags a completed mat can take 700 or more bags flat surface for folding scissors or a rotary cutter and mat to crochet the mat note finished plarn lots i have presented the instructions in two formats the first is a condensed format with only the necessary information the crochet hook size q 16mm second is more in-depth with tips tricks and pictures please scissors follow whichever format you prefer tape measure optional estimating is fine condensed instructions are on pages 2 3 caution tape or other sturdy material full-length plarn instructions are on pages 4-5 for straps optional straps can be made from plarn full-length crochet instructions are on pages 6- for an informative video about plarn follow this youtube link https //youtu be/vb-3qkbvous 1 condensed instructions to make plarn flatten bags tucking in sides optional stack bags up to three high for quicker process fold bags in half with the handles touching handles and bottom touching bottom fold bags in half again in the same direction using scissors or rotary cutter cut off handles and bottom of bag and discard cut remaining bag into two-inch strips open these strips to find loops loop the loops together by first passing the second loop through the first loop and then through itself using this method make a long string of loops take care not to make this string too long when wound into a ball it should pass easily through one loop wind the string into a ball optional secure by wrapping the free loop around the ball or by any other method when crocheting when you reach the end of the ball simply loop the next one on using the same looping method to crochet a sleeping mat mat body with plarn chain 71 single_crochet in second chain from hook and in every chain to end chain 1 and turn *1 single_crochet in each chain to end chain 1 and turn repeat from * until mat measures roughly 6 ft 180cm from chain edge border work a round of single_crochet around entire mat placing one single_crochet in each st and row and 3 single_crochet in each corner fasten_off 2 condensed instructions continued finishing weave in ends and knot to secure straps make 2 using plarn or sturdier
